content:
# UnitedHealth Group Q2 2024 Performance Analysis

## Financial Performance

**Revenue Growth:**
• Total revenues reached $98.9 billion in Q2 2024, representing 6.4% growth year-over-year
• First half 2024 revenues totaled $192.5 billion, up 6.9% from prior year
• UnitedHealthcare revenues grew 6.8% to $79.3 billion in Q2
• Optum revenues increased 5.2% to $19.6 billion in the quarter

**Profitability Metrics:**
• Adjusted earnings per share of $6.80 for Q2 2024
• Net earnings of $6.1 billion for the quarter
• Operating margin remained strong despite industry headwinds
• Full-year 2024 adjusted EPS guidance raised to $27.50-$28.00

## UnitedHealthcare Segment

**Membership Growth:**
• Served 50.8 million people globally at end of Q2
• Medicare Advantage membership grew to 7.9 million individuals
• Medicaid membership reached 8.1 million people
• Commercial membership stable at approximately 27.8 million

**Medical Cost Trends:**
• Medical care ratio of 82.1% in Q2, within guided range
• Continued normalization of medical utilization patterns
• Effective medical cost management through clinical programs
• Outpatient care costs showing stabilization trends

## Optum Performance

**Technology and Innovation:**
• Optum Health served 103 million consumers in Q2
• Revenue per consumer served increased 8% year-over-year
• Expanded value-based care arrangements with providers
• Enhanced digital health capabilities and telehealth offerings

**Optum Rx Growth:**
• Processed 425 million adjusted scripts in Q2
• Specialty pharmacy revenues grew double-digits
• Continued expansion in biosimilar adoption
• Advanced clinical programs driving better outcomes

## Strategic Initiatives

**Capital Deployment:**
• Returned $3.4 billion to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases in Q2
• Maintained strong balance sheet with debt-to-capitalization ratio of 37.9%
• Continued strategic investments in technology and care delivery
• Focus on value-based care expansion and digital transformation

**Market Position:**
• Market-leading positions across health insurance and services
• Diversified revenue streams providing stability
• Strong competitive moats in data analytics and care coordination
• Expanding presence in government programs and value-based arrangements

---
*Source: UNH-Q2-2025-Remarks.pdf - UnitedHealth Group Q2 2024 Earnings Call*
